content.question: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. The number of fish in a small bay is modeled by the function <math alttext="F"><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></math> defined by <math alttext="F of t equals, 10 times, open parenthesis, t cubed, minus, 12 times t squared, plus 45 t, plus 100, close parenthesis"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>12</mn><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>45</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>100</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in days and <math alttext="0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 8"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Using correct units, interpret the meaning of <math alttext="F prime of 4, equals negative 30"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>30</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> in the context of the problem.

frqParts.text: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. The number of fish in a small bay is modeled by the function <math alttext="F"><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></math> defined by <math alttext="F of t equals, 10 times, open parenthesis, t cubed, minus, 12 times t squared, plus 45 t, plus 100, close parenthesis"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>12</mn><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>45</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>100</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in days and <math alttext="0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 8"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Using correct units, interpret the meaning of <math alttext="F prime of 4, equals negative 30"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>30</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> in the context of the problem.

(b) Based on the model, what is the absolute minimum number of fish in the bay over the time interval <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to t, which is less than or equal to 8 "><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Justify your answer.

(c) For what values of <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 8"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, is the rate of change of the number of fish in the bay decreasing?

(d) For <math alttext="0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 8"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the number of pelicans flying near the bay is modeled by the differentiable function <math alttext="P"><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></math>, where <math alttext="P"><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></math> is a function of the number of fish in the bay. Based on the models, write an expression for the rate of change of the number of pelicans flying near the bay at time <math alttext="t equals c"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
